subject: Fashion
title: Renaissance Corset Origins
description: A quick win: understand Renaissance Corset Origins.

hook.text: The first corsets weren't designed for beauty. They were built to flatten the chest completely.

buildup.text: In the 1500s, European women wore stiffened bodices reinforced with wood, whalebone, or metal.

discovery.text: These rigid 'stays' reshaped the torso into a cone. Posture was controlled from the outside in.

twist.text: Men wore corsets too. Renaissance soldiers used them under armor for back support in battle.

climax.text: The corset wasn't just clothingâ€”it was a body-reshaping device that dominated fashion for 400 years.

punchline.text: Fashion's longest power move started with a plank of wood.

quiz.question: What was the original purpose of Renaissance-era corsets?
options: To enhance the bust for a curvy silhouette
To flatten the chest and reshape the torso into a cone
To protect the ribs during horseback riding
